Vuttaka，（nt．） [vutta1+ka．The P．conneetion seems to be vac，although formally it may be derived fr．vṛt “to happen” etc．（cp．vuttin & vattin，both fr．vṛt，& vutti）．The BSk．equivalent is vṛttaka “tale” （lit．happening），e．g．Divy 439] what has been said，saying； only in title of a canonical book “iti-vuttakaṁ” （“logia”）：see under iti．（Page 645）
